alert.note: Alert for Davidson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 7:33PM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Stones River Near Donelson affecting Davidson County. For the Stones River...including Donelson...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Stones River Near Donelson. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, The Stones River Greenway is impassable at a few locations between Percy Priest Dam and Lebanon Road, and the park area on Jackson Downs Blvd is mostly inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 26.3 feet and cresting. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 200 PM CST.
